> We have documentation for it, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/ui/README.md#profile
> 
> If you want to understand more, read
> 
> * CN,  https://www.infoq.cn/article/CWUOl1JA0EyXw0CxQ4Zm
> * EN,  https://thenewstack.io/apache-skywalking-use-profiling-to-fix-the-blind-spot-of-distributed-tracing/
> 
> I recommend you to read all these.

I got it,and it's help me a lot,thank you very much~

> How many shards will be created in es7 totally? In es7 the maximum of shard in single node is 1000 in default and it's not enough apparently

This is increasing with days and TTL, consider to use skywalking 7/8(master), they reduce the number of index much. 7 is -50%, 8 is -75% comparing to 6.6

> If I want persist metric data for 2 weeks，with hundreds of service instances，how do I estimate the peek number of shards

That has nothing related to shards, default should be enough.

> I suppose skywalking will help me delete the expired index in es

Yes, when TTLs are reached.
You could remove the kafka plugin, then everything should be fine, just trace and topology breaks at this point.

@krmeda The action is happening, as we are going to enhance the UI dashboard. 

https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r79e6e0057bc16a3df77234286753404149652dcd35c3378312f23c11%40%3Cdev.skywalking.apache.org%3E

You could use this way to join our mail list for joining the discussion and action progress.
> Mail list: dev@skywalking.apache.org. Mail to dev-subscribe@skywalking.apache.org, follow the reply to subscribe the mail list.
Or if you have time, we could set up an online meeting. You could help me on a quick and accurate understanding of the micrometer
Seems like a MySQL plugin issue. Please make sure the version is in the supported list.
N/A means, nothing tracing is not working in this context. You could submit pull request to make this works.
the mysql version,our mysql version is 5.7.27

According to https://github.com/apache/skywalking/tree/master/test/plugin/scenarios/mysql-scenario, I think we didn't test 5.7.27.

Here are the tested version list, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/test/plugin/scenarios/mysql-scenario/support-version.list.

If 5.7 has some incompatible changes, the plugin is required to follow those change. If you are interesting, consider to debug why and send a pull request to fix this.

I think if the JDBC.Driver plugin is not supported ,the log have same WARN:
WARN 2020-04-16 16:09:48:618 http-nio-8080-exec-1 AbstractClassEnhancePluginDefine : enhance class com.mysql.jdbc.Driver by plugin org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.jdbc.mysql.v6.define.DriverInstrumentation is not working. Because witness class **com.mysql.cj.api.MysqlConnection is not existed**. 
WARN 2020-04-16 16:09:48:638 http-nio-8080-exec-1 AbstractClassEnhancePluginDefine : enhance class com.mysql.jdbc.NonRegisteringDriver by plugin org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.jdbc.mysql.v6.define.DriverInstrumentation is not working. Because witness class com.mysql.cj.api.MysqlConnection is not existed.
That is v6 detection mechanism. You are facing incompatible in the 5.x
OK,Tks，I try it again.
If you make the tracing works with your across thread case, then yes. Read plugin development documentation. They are there.
No, we are not today. If you want to do, welcome to contribute to add `org.apache.skywalking.apm.toolkit.trace.ActiveSpan#setOperationName`.

Socket is not a safe protocol, it is at the kernel level. We can't and no one can provide a common plugin for that. You need to understand the real transport protocol, and inject the context into the header of your protocol.

> Socket is not a safe protocol, it is at the kernel level. We can't and no one can provide a common plugin for that. You need to understand the real transport protocol, and inject the context into the header of your protocol.

i only want to know the time cost ,it does't need to parse response , Is it feasible

Subscribe our mail list, we will send the meeting link there.

I recommend you to debug and find out why. We have plugin test cases in the test folder, Check the versions and how we test them.
Now, it is ready for review. @mrproliu @wu-sheng @kezhenxu94

English only, you could set up gRPC-supported load balance/proxy by your own. We don't need to rewrite this, many great open source projects are there, including Nginx, Envoy.
@wu-sheng this may happen if multiple jobs write the coverage execution data to the same file,  I'll try to fix it in #4674 as well, just rerun and ignore it in this PR
After using nginx, still need to use zookeeper ？
You are sending agent data to a HTTP port, rather than our oap grpc port.

We never required zookeeper, it is just a backend coordinator option. If you want to set up OAP cluster,  choose at least one coordinator. As it is named as coordinator, it is for OAP cluster, it has nothing related to the agent.
